title: Nick Kochan
text:
Nick Kochan is a financial and political journalist based in <a href="London">London</a>. He has written extensively on <a href="financial%20crime">financial</a> and <a href="white%20collar%20crime">white collar crime</a>. He writes for UK newspapers and international magazines, and has written and co-written books. Kochan is also a lecturer and conference speaker on <a href="financial%20crime">financial crime</a> and <a href="politics">politics</a>.
Early life and education.
Kochan was educated at <a href="Magdalen%20College%20School%2C%20Oxford">Magdalen College School</a> in <a href="Oxford">Oxford</a>, and at <a href="Fitzwilliam%20College%2C%20Cambridge">Fitzwilliam College, Cambridge</a>, graduating in <a href="Classics">Classics</a> and <a href="English%20Literature">English</a> in 1976.

Kochan is also a Contributing Editor to <a href="Euromoney%20Magazine">Euromoney Magazine</a> and contributing editor to <a href="The%20Banker">The Banker</a>.
Radio and television journalism.
Kochan regularly appears on <a href="BBC%20Radio">BBC Radio</a> and <a href="BBC%20TV">TV</a> and <a href="Sky">Sky</a> as an expert on <a href="money%20laundering">money laundering</a>, <a href="economics">economics</a>, <a href="finance">finance</a>, <a href="politics">politics</a> and <a href="terrorism">terrorist finance</a>.
Kochan interviewed 12 British businessmen for two series of six programmes about entrepreneurs for <a href="BBC%20Radio%20Four">BBC Radio Four</a>. He also conducted six radio interviews with Jewish writers for another BBC Radio Four series.
In 1990, Kochan researched a "Despatches" programme for <a href="Channel%20Four">Channel Four</a> about the <a href="Guinness%20affair">Guinness affair</a>.
